titleStmt.title: The authours, nature, and danger of hæresie. Laid open in a sermon preached before the Honorable House of Commons at Margarets Westminster, upon Wednesday the tenth of March, 1646. being set apart as a solemne day of publike humiliation to seeke Gods assistance for the suppressing and preventing of the growth and spreading of errours, heresies, and blasphemies. / By Richard Vines. Printed by order of the House of Commons.
titleStmt.author: Vines, Richard, 1600?-1656.

titleStmt.title: The authours, nature, and danger of hæresie. Laid open in a sermon preached before the Honorable House of Commons at Margarets Westminster, upon Wednesday the tenth of March, 1646. being set apart as a solemne day of publike humiliation to seeke Gods assistance for the suppressing and preventing of the growth and spreading of errours, heresies, and blasphemies. / By Richard Vines. Printed by order of the House of Commons.
titleStmt.author: Vines, Richard, 1600?-1656.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by W. Wilson for Abel Roper, and are to be sold at his shop at the Sun over against Dunstans Church in Fleetstreet.,

notesStmt.note: Order to print on verso of final leaf.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
